description.p: We live our lives taking each second for granted. But what would you do if you knew how much time you had left? Warlocks of Unus Annus seek to answer this question. By taking this pack, they knowingly put a time limit on their lives, and intend on living out their lives to the fullest. Warlocks of this pact are perfectly content with the limited time of their lives, for they understand that all things must die, as is the natural order of things. They view undead as abominations that must all be destroyed, much like worshipers of the Raven Queen.

description.p: Starting when you make this pact at 1st level, you are doomed to die in 1d20 years. You always know how much time you have left.

sheet.description: Starting when you make this pact at 1st level, you are doomed to die in 1d20 years. You always know how much time you have left.

description.p: Also at 1st level, you choose which of the two beings resonates with you the most, and decide whether you're an Unus or an Annus. Choose one of the following features. Once you choose one, you cannot choose another one.
Voice of Unus. You've decided that you are an Unus, and wear black robes to show it. As an Unus, you are proficient in the Performance and Persuasion skills.
Voice of Annus. You've decided that you are an Annus, and wear white robes to show it. As an Annus, you are proficient in the Athletics and Performance skills.

description.p: At 6th level, you are gifted a specialized weapon from Unus and Annus. As an action, you can summon a scythe made of black or white flames, the color depending on whether you're an Unus or an Annus for 1 minute. This scythe deals necrotic damage equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, and you gain a number of hit points equivalent to the damage you dealt.

Additionally, if you use this scythe against an undead, you deal an additional 1d6 and deal radiant damage instead of necrotic damage, however you do not gain any hit points. This scythe is dispelled one you have been knocked unconscious or you dispel it as a bonus action. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.
This scythe's damage increases to 1d8 at 10th level, 1d10 at 14th level, and 1d12 at 18th level.

description.p: At 10th level, you learn to turn your mistakes into dangerous means of success by improvising. Whenever you miss with an attack or spell, you can reroll it with a Performance check, and you have to take the new roll. If you roll a natural 1, you end up hitting yourself. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier per long rest.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, Unus and Annus are aware of your time left and wish to see you live out every single second. Whenever you make a death save, you roll with advantage. In addition, if you roll a natural 20 on a death save, you immediately stabilize and heal a number of hit points equal to half your Warlock level + your Constitution modifier.
